did.unittitle: Gary Restaurant and Railroad Crossing Photograph ca.1990
did.abstract: Photograph of Gary restaurant and railroad crossing in McDowell Company-run Gary Township, West Virginia, circa 1990.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Gary Restaurant and Railroad Crossing Photograph, Ms2010-008, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Gary Restaurant and Railroad Crossing photograph was donated to Special Collections in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Gary Restaurant and Railroad Crossing photograph commenced and was completed in February, 2010.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The restaurant featured in the photograph was built in 1913, and is located in Gary Township, West Virginia. By 1920, the restaurant underwent extensive expansion.
Gary Township was a McDowell company-run town; it was the center of a booming steel and coal camp that operated until the 1970s. The town's prep plant was once the largest in the world.
GARY, WV. Southern West Virginia Coalfields. Web. 26 Feb. 2010. http://www.coalcampusa.com/sowv/flattop/gary/gary.htm .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This photograph features Gary Restaurant, a railroad, and a horse-drawn wagon. It was taken in the early 1990s.
